apps.tree.scheduling
Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
  apps.tree.scheduling.Scheduler

public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object

This class acts as the coordinator of all scheduling activities in the simulation, working with the Process, ProcessSource, and Processor classes.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

Field Summary
(package private)  int clock
          Clock that keeps total simulation time.
(package private)  Processor cpu
          Processor that executes processes.
(package private)  int intervalClock
          Clock that keeps time for latest simulation interval of interest.
(package private)  int intervalNumProcs
          Number of process that have arrived in the system in the latest simulation interval of interest.
(package private)  int intervalThruPut
          Number of processors that have completed execution in the latest simulation interval of interest.
(package private)  int numProcs
          Total number of processes that have arrived in the simulation system so far.
(package private)  Heap<Process> procHeap
          Processor heap that stores processes that are in the scheduling system in a priority queue.
(package private)  ProcessSource source
          Source that delivers new processes to the simulation system.
(package private)  int thruPut
          Total number ofprocessors that have completed execution so far.

          Initializes a new instance by setting the process priority queue to empty.

Method Detail

init

public void init(float probOfArrival,
                 int maxExecTime,
                 int maxPriority,
                 int timeSlice)
Initializes various scheduling parameters with given values.

Parameters:
probOfArrival - Probability of arrival of a new process in a simulation unit of time.
maxExecTime - Maximum execution time of a process.
maxPriority - Maximum priority of a process.
timeSlice - Time slice to be asssigned to each process at the processor.

run

public void run(int howLong)
         throws BusyInterruptionException
Runs the simulation for a given number of unit time intervals.

Parameters:
howLong - Number of unit time intervals for which to run the simulation.
Throws:
BusyInterruptionException - If the processor is interrupted when it is busy executing a process.

printStatus

public void printStatus(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Prints the status of the simulation system.

Parameters:
pw - PrintWriter used to print status.

printHeap

public void printHeap(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Prints the contents of the process priority queue/heap.

Parameters:
pw - PrintWriter used to write heap.

printProcessor

public void printProcessor(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Prints the contents of the CPU

Parameters:
pw - PrintWriter used to print cpu contents.
